0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• para-Aminohippurate renal clearance measurement: priming dose, 6 to 10 mg/kg IV
  • para-Aminohippurate renal clearance measurement: infusion dose, 10 to 24 mg/min IV
  • para-Aminohippurate renal clearance measurement: optimal concentration of aminohippurate sodium in plasma is 2 mg per 100 mL
  • para-Aminohippurate renal clearance measurement: normal ERPF values are 675 +/- 150 mL/min (men) and 595 +/- 125 mL/min (women)
  • Renal tubular disorder; Diagnosis: usual concentration range, 40 to 60 mg per 100 mL in order to sufficiently saturate the capacity of the tubular secretory cells

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and effectiveness in pediatric patients not established

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • para-Aminohippurate renal clearance measurement
  • Renal tubular disorder; Diagnosis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to aminohippurate sodium or any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• adverse reactions may occur; administer IV slowly; monitoring recommended
  • concomitant use of probenecid; may result in erroneously low effective renal plasma flow (ERPF) and the functional capacity of the renal tubular secretory mechanism or transport maximum (Tm(PAH)) values
  • concomitant use of procaine, sulfonamides, or thiazolsulfone; accuracy of results are compromised due to interference with chemical color development
  • latex sensitivity; vial stopper contains dry natural rubber that may cause allergic reactions
  • low cardiac reserve; rapid increase in plasma volume may precipitate congestive heart failure

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Since aminohippurate sodium has a high renal clearance rate (90% of administered dose is cleared by the kidneys in a single circulation), plasma and urine aminohippurate sodium concentrations are used in a calculation to determine the effective renal plasma flow, and the functional capacity of the renal tubular secretory mechanism or transport maximum (Tm(PAH)).

3.title: Excretion
3.mono: Renal: 90% (at aminohippurate sodium plasma concentrations of 1 to 2 mg/100 mL)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
General Information
  • efficacy not affected by discoloration within normal color range (ie, colorless to yellow/brown)
  • for IV use only

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• accurate measurements of the effective renal plasma flow (ERPF) and the functional capacity of the renal tubular secretory mechanism or transport maximum (Tm(PAH)) are indicative of efficacy
  • adverse effects; continuously during IV administration
